_children.C: This joseki is especially effective for White when Black [r17] has extensions around [l17] and [r10]. Black can now attack White but no longer expect much territory here (compare with what a shimari [r17]â€“[q15] would yield with  [l17]â€“[r10]). For that reason, with [l17]â€“[r10] Black may prefer to play [p18] at [r15] (see [path:qcttpittkcpdqdpeqepfqfpgqgphqhoipjmc]). [src:38bj,p. 14 Dia. 7,8]
This move leaves a severe cut for black. Black may also extend on the right side before playing this continuation.

Situational move.
Get Strong At Joseki. Vol. 3. Pr. 132.
